sunday	 The day of the week after Saturday and before Monday, when most people in Western countries do not go to work
sundial	 A device used outside, especially in the past, which consists of a thin piece of metal fixed to a flat surface printed with numbers. It shows the time by the metal making a dark line on the surface as the sun moves across the sky.
sundown	 The time in the evening when you last see the sun in the sky
sundries	 Various different small things that are considered together, usually because they are not important enough to be considered separately

sunspot	 A dark spot on the surface of the sun that appears for a few days or weeks and then disappears

suntan	 Pleasantly brown skin caused by being in hot sun

vixen	 A female fox

vocabulary	 All the words known and used by a particular person

voiced	 (of a speech sound) produced by making the vocal cords move very quickly several times
voiceless	 Describes a group of people who do not have the power or the legal right to express their opinions

volatile	 Likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly or suddenly become violent or angry

volley	 A large number of bullets (seeming to be) fired at the same time
volleyball	 A game in which two teams use their hands to hit a large ball backwards and forwards over a high net without allowing the ball to touch the ground
volt	 The standard unit used to measure how strongly an electrical current is sent around an electrical system

voluptuous	 Describes a woman who has a soft, curved, sexually attractive body
vomit	 To empty the contents of the stomach through the mouth
voodoo	 A type of religion involving magic and the worship of spirits (= people who cannot be seen), especially common in Haiti
voracious	 Very eager for something, especially a lot of food
vortex	 A mass of air or water that spins around very fast and pulls objects into its empty centre
vote	 To express your choice or opinion, especially by officially writing a mark on a paper or by raising your hand or speaking in a meeting
voter	 A person who votes or who has a legal right to vote, especially in an election

vow	 To make a determined decision or promise to do something

voyage	 A long journey, especially by ship
voyager	 A person who goes on a long and sometimes dangerous journey

vroom	 Used in writing to represent the sound of a car engine at high speed
vs	 Written abbreviation for versus
vulcanized	 Vulcanized rubber has been made stronger by a chemical process.
